item.title: Michele add a quote by Theodore Dreiser
item.description: "People in general attach too much importance to words. They are under the illusion that talking effects great results. As a matter of fact, words are, as a rule, the shallowest portion of all the argument. They but dimly represent the great surging feelings and desires which lie behind. When the distraction of the tongue is removed, the heart listens." -- Theodore Dreiser

item.title: Michele add a quote by Alexander McCall Smith
item.description: "You can go through life and make new friends every year - every month practically - but there was never any substitute for those friendships of childhood that survive into adult years. Those are the ones in which we are bound to one another with hoops of steel." -- Alexander McCall Smith

item.title: Michele add a quote by George Elliot
item.description: "There is no despair so absolute as that which comes from the first moments of our first great sorrow when we have not yet known what it is to have suffered and healed, to have despaired and recovered hope." -- George Elliot

item.title: Michele add a quote by Dinah Maria Mulock Craik
item.description: "Oh, the comfort — the inexpressible comfort of feeling <i>safe</i> with a person — having neither to weigh thoughts nor measure words, but pouring them all right out, just as they are, chaff and grain together; certain that a faithful hand will take and sift them, keep what is worth keeping, and then with the breath of kindness blow the rest away." -- Dinah Maria Mulock Craik

item.title: Michele add a quote by Clive James
item.description: "Common sense and a sense of humor are the same thing, moving at different speeds. A sense of humor is just common sense, dancing." -- Clive James

item.title: Michele add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "She feels in italics and thinks in CAPITALS." -- Henry James

item.title: Michele add a quote by Voltaire
item.description:
"I have never made but one prayer to God, a very short one: Oh Lord, make my enemies ridiculous. And God granted it."
(<i>Letter to Étienne Noël Damilaville</i>, May 16, 1767)" -- Voltaire

item.title: Michele add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Michele add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Michele add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "People love a happy ending. So every episode, I will explain once again that I don't like people. And then Mal will shoot someone. Someone we like. And their puppy." -- Joss Whedon
